description: From English tri- +‎ -logy, from Latin trilogia, from Ancient Greek τριλογίᾱ (trilogíā, “trilogy”).

entries.meaning: A set of three works of art that are connected, and that can be seen either as a single work or as three individual works. They are commonly found in literature, film, or video games.
examples: That such a safe adaptation could come of The Hunger Games speaks more to the trilogy’s commercial ascent than the book’s actual content, which is audacious and savvy in its dark calculations.
